summary: This is a U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General evidence custody memorandum documenting the transfer of two computers from the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York to the OIG New York Field Office on August 16, 2019, as part of investigation 2019-010614. The computers were received from MCC personnel and transferred between OIG Special Agents for processing.

persons.name: Kevin Mcccamack
persons.context: Appears as the preparer of the evidence custody document, with a signature and date.

events.title: Receipt of computers from MCC
events.description: OIG New York Field Office Special Agents received two computers from the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York's Special Investigative Section Lieutenant as part of OIG investigation 2019-010614.

events.title: Transfer of computer custody
events.description: The Special Agent who received the computers transferred custody of them to another OIG NYFO Special Agent for further processing.

keyFacts: Two computers were obtained from the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York on August 16, 2019, as part of OIG investigation 2019-010614.
The evidence transfer is documented on an OIG Form III-234/1 (Evidence Custody Document).
The document is related to the OIG's investigation into matters at the MCC, likely surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
The document explicitly states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the OIG.
Custody of the computers was transferred between OIG Special Agents on August 19, 2019, for further processing.
